ftp

Class FTPClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ftp.FTPClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class FTPClient
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class represent the client which is connected on the server It is initialized with one parameter which is the socket on which it communicates with our server.
    Author:
    Tanguy Mar√©chal, Allan Rakotoarivony

        public FTPClient(java.net.Socket clientSocket,
         FTPServer ftpServer)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Constructor of a FTPClient. It takes as a parameter a socket on which the client communicates with the FTPServer
        Parameters:
        clientSocket - this socket must communicate with the FTPServer
        ftpServer -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when creating the FTPClient or if the socket is not connected.

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()

      • processRequest

        public void processRequest()
        Execute all requests given by the client. It is an infinite loop which process every requests from the client until he quits. When the client quits or the connection is broken, the processing stops and this method finish by closing all sockets and reader and writer for this client.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • closeDataSocket

        public void closeDataSocket()
                     throws java.io.IOException
        this method close the dataSocket of this FTPClient if not null or if it isn't yet closed. It close also all reader and writer on the dataSocket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • closeDataServerSocket

        public void closeDataServerSocket()
